item.title: ERM: Empirical Risk Minimization
item.description: A negative log likelihood (NLL) for a model $\theta$ of dataset $\mathcal D$ $$ NLL(\theta) = -\log p(\mathcal D\mid\theta) = -\sum_n \log (y_n \mid x_n, \theta). $$ An empirical risk loss function $\mathcal L$ is $$ \mathcal L(\theta) = \frac{1}{N} \sum_n \mathscr l(y_n, \theta; x_n), $$ where $\mathscr l$ is a loss. For example, one could design a stepwise loss in classification $$ \mathscr l = \begin{cases} 0, \qquad \text{if prediction matches data} \\ 1 \qquad \text{if prediction doesn't match data} \end{cases} $$ Another possibility is surrogate loss which is continuous.
